column4: HELP. I let my one laptop's battery die today while it was booted into ubuntu without relising it, and when i came back i logged in fine but neither metacity nor my panels came up!
can you get to a terminal? (not ctrl-alt-f1)
yes, but i can't get online..
try running this in terminal: nautilus --no-default-window
nautilus --no-default-window returns to prompt? it doesn't give you an error or anything?
returns too prompt. with both quotes and without
that can happen. what does apt-get say about it? does it show it as installed?
nope. i figured it out, it got removed when i tryed too remove evolution! i got if-up too connect, r4eset and download
cool. i rip out most of that junk at install, so i set up a start up app with that "nautilus --no-default-window" command, otherwide i have no dekstop.
yea. never remove evolution-data-server... that'swhat did it
i just sudo apt-get remove evolution, but like i said after that, no more desktop without my little cheat.
glad to be a help, but you pretty much solved this one on your own.
check this out: that's one uncluttered desktop! http://postimage.org/image/1dl88znyc/
